flixel.system.FlxSound

type
class
extends
flixel.FlxBasic
This is the universal flixel sound object, used for streaming, music, and sound effects.

Constructor

new()
The FlxSound constructor gets all the variables initialized, but NOT ready to play a sound yet.

Instance Variables hide inherited show inherited

ID : Int

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
IDs seem like they could be pretty useful, huh? They're not actually used for anything yet though.

active(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether update() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

alive(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Useful state for many game objects - "dead" (!alive) vs alive. kill() and revive() both flip this switch (along with exists, but you can override that).

amplitude : Float

Stores the average wave amplitude of both stereo channels

amplitudeLeft : Float

Just the amplitude of the left stereo channel

amplitudeRight : Float

Just the amplitude of the left stereo channel

artist : String

The ID3 artist name. Defaults to null. Currently only works for streamed sounds.

autoDestroy : Bool

Whether to call destroy() when the sound has finished.

cameras : Array<FlxCamera>

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
An array of camera objects that this object will use during draw(). This value will initialize itself during the first draw to automatically point at the main camera list out in FlxG unless you already set it. You can also change it afterward too, very flexible!

collisionType : flixel.system.FlxCollisionType

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

exists(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
This flag indicates whether this objects has been destroyed or not. Cannot be set, use destroy() and revive().

ignoreDrawDebug : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Setting this to true will prevent the object from appearing when the visual debug mode in the debugger overlay is toggled on.

name : String

The ID3 song name. Defaults to null. Currently only works for streamed sounds.

onComplete : Void -> Void

Tracker for sound complete callback. Default is null. If assigend, will be called each time when sound reaches its end. Works only on flash and desktop targets.

playing(accessor,null) : Bool

Whether or not the sound is currently playing.

survive : Bool

Whether or not this sound should be automatically destroyed when you switch states.

visible(default,accessor) : Bool

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Controls whether draw() is automatically called by FlxState/FlxGroup.

volume(accessor,accessor) : Float

Set volume to a value between 0 and 1 to change how this sound is.

x : Float

The X position of this sound in world coordinates. Only really matters if you are doing proximity/panning stuff.

y : Float

The Y position of this sound in world coordinates. Only really matters if you are doing proximity/panning stuff.

Instance Methods hide inherited show inherited

destroy() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic
Clean up memory.

draw() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Override this function to control how the object is drawn. Overriding draw() is rarely necessary, but can be very useful.

drawDebug() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic

drawDebugOnCamera(?Camera : FlxCamera) : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
parameters
Camera Which camera to draw the debug visuals to.
Override this function to draw custom "debug mode" graphics to the specified camera while the debugger's visual mode is toggled on.

fadeIn(Seconds : Float) : Void

parameters
Seconds The amount of time the fade-in operation should take.
Call this function to make a sound fade in over a certain time interval (calls play() automatically).

fadeOut(Seconds : Float, ?PauseInstead : Bool) : Void

parameters
Seconds The amount of time the fade out operation should take.
PauseInstead Tells the sound to pause on fadeout, instead of stopping.
Call this function to make this sound fade out over a certain time interval.

getActualVolume() : Float

returns
The adjusted volume of the sound.
Returns the currently selected "real" volume of the sound (takes fades and proximity into account).

kill() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic

loadEmbedded(EmbeddedSound : Dynamic, ?Looped : Bool, ?AutoDestroy : Bool, ?OnComplete : Void -> Void) : FlxSound

parameters
EmbeddedSound An embedded Class object representing an MP3 file.
Looped Whether or not this sound should loop endlessly.
AutoDestroy Whether or not this FlxSound instance should be destroyed when the sound finishes playing. Default value is false, but FlxG.sound.play() and FlxG.sound.stream() will set it to true by default.
returns
This FlxSound instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
One of two main setup functions for sounds, this function loads a sound from an embedded MP3.

loadStream(SoundURL : String, ?Looped : Bool, ?AutoDestroy : Bool, ?OnComplete : Void -> Void) : FlxSound

parameters
EmbeddedSound A string representing the URL of the MP3 file you want to play.
Looped Whether or not this sound should loop endlessly.
AutoDestroy Whether or not this FlxSound instance should be destroyed when the sound finishes playing. Default value is false, but FlxG.sound.play() and FlxG.sound.stream() will set it to true by default.
returns
This FlxSound instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
One of two main setup functions for sounds, this function loads a sound from a URL.

pause() : Void

Call this function to pause this sound.

play(?ForceRestart : Bool) : Void

parameters
ForceRestart Whether to start the sound over or not. Default value is false, meaning if the sound is already playing or was paused when you call play(), it will continue playing from its current position, NOT start again from the beginning.
Call this function to play the sound - also works on paused sounds.

proximity(X : Float, Y : Float, TargetObject : flixel.FlxObject, Radius : Float, ?Pan : Bool) : FlxSound

parameters
X The X position of the sound.
Y The Y position of the sound.
TargetObject The object you want to track.
Radius The maximum distance this sound can travel.
Pan Whether the sound should pan in addition to the volume changes (default: true).
returns
This FlxSound instance (nice for chaining stuff together, if you're into that).
Call this function if you want this sound's volume to change based on distance from a particular FlxCore object.

resume() : Void

Unpause a sound. Only works on sounds that have been paused.

revive() : Void

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Handy function for bringing game objects "back to life". Just sets alive and exists back to true. In practice, this function is most often called by FlxObject.reset().

stop() : Void

Call this function to stop this sound.

toString() : String

inherited from flixel.FlxBasic
Convert object to readable string name. Useful for debugging, save games, etc.

update() : Void

overrides flixel.FlxBasic
Handles fade out, fade in, panning, proximity, and amplitude operations each frame.
